intro: Pseudochimarrhis diformis, commonly known as the variable pseudochimarrhis, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in coastal or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand salty air and windy conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in coastal heathlands and dunes.
